intro: Obione acuminata, commonly known as the sharp-pointed obione, is a species of flowering plant native to specific regions of South America. It belongs to the family Malvaceae, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its slender, erect stems and narrow, lance-shaped leaves. Its flowers are typically small and yellow, arranged in clusters at the ends of the branches. Obione acuminata is often found in dry, open habitats and is adapted to withstand arid conditions.
